title: Add more space between validation message and the label of the next field
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug / feature request

#### What is the expected behavior?
More space to validation message and next field label

#### What is the current behavior?
Validation message and next field label are too close to each other

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

https://embed.plnkr.co/Vbt29I0lCmhJtaBZNK8e/

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Better UI

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angualr latest, Material latest, Windows 10, Typescript 2.3.3

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I'm not quite sure if this is something we as a developer need too change to our preferences or that it should be standardized within Angular Material.
The current standard is pretty ugly as you can see in the screenshot below, shouldn't there be more space between the label and the error message?
![validation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/810038/29164099-b7ba14d6-7dbe-11e7-8a48-bc2eb72343de.PNG)

title: md-table is not working in lazy loaded modules
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug, md-table is not working in lazy loaded module components
Message: 'Can't bind to 'dataSource' since it isn't a known property of 'md-table''

#### What is the expected behavior?
In lazy module if I imported 'CdkTableModule', md-table should work.

> Sample lazy Module @NgModule({
    imports: [
        CdkTableModule,
        TestTableRoutingModule
    ],
    declarations: [
        ShowTableComponent
    ]
})
export class TestTableModule {
}

If 'ShowTableComponent' has md-table it should because I am importing 'CdkTableModule' module

#### What is the current behavior?
If i try to access lazy loaded component using URL, its showing below error
![mad-table-error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7432941/29140899-cb1751c4-7d69-11e7-8fdd-662741b9d753.png)
NOTE: I tried md-table in app.component without using lazy modules it worked fine.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

- Create a module
- declare a component in newly created component
- load from app module using routes
- when url provided to load component, you will get above error


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
OS: Windows 10
Angular: 4.3.3
Angular-Material, Angular-CDK: 2.0.0-beta.8
Angular-cli: 1.1.1
Node: 8.1.2
NPM: 5.03
Browser: Chrome
#### Is there anything else we should know?

title: [Bug] Dialogs don't work on platform WorkerUI
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
A dialog should work on all platforms.

#### What is the current behavior?
A dialog causes an error when the platform is worker ui.

`ERROR ReferenceError: document is not defined
    at Overlay../node_modules/@angular/material/@angular/material.es5.js.Overlay._createPaneElement (material.es5.js:2816)
    at Overlay../node_modules/@angular/material/@angular/material.es5.js.Overlay.create (material.es5.js:2801)
    at MdDialog../node_modules/@angular/material/@angular/material.es5.js.MdDialog._createOverlay (material.es5.js:17843)
    at MdDialog../node_modules/@angular/material/@angular/material.es5.js.MdDialog.open (material.es5.js:17811)
    at AppComponent../src/app/app.component.ts.AppComponent.openDialog (`

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Run Angular in a webworker and try to use the Angular Material dialog.

I've made a repo to show this behavior.

https://github.com/Owain94/material-dialog-error


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Angular ^4.0.0
cdk ^2.0.0-beta.8
material ^2.0.0-beta.8

title: md-input-container invalid font
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
`md-input-container` component has to use a valid font value for the class `.mat-input-container`

#### What is the current behavior?
`md-input-container` component  using an invalid font value for the class `.mat-input-container`

```css
.mat-input-container {
    font: 400 inherit/1.125 Roboto, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif;
}
```

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Same steps that issue [#5262](https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/5262)


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
OS: Ubuntu 16.04
Angular: 4.3.3
Typescript: 2.2.0
"@angular/material": "2.0.0-beta.8",

browsers: Chrome, Chromium

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I think this problem was fixed last month but is it in beta.8 release?

Thanks.

title: test(): screenshot diff for button-toggle
body: * Adds the button-toggle overview example to the e2e app and captures a screenshot diff for it.

title: MdInput underline hover is missing
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Something between bug and feature request

#### What is the expected behavior?
I just saw, while scrolling through the material guidelines, that the underline of the MdInput should have a hover effect.

https://material.io/guidelines/components/text-fields.html#text-fields-states
Then go to hover.

#### What is the current behavior?
There is no hover effect for the underline

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
See the docs.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Adapt the material guidelines correctly.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular Material Beta 8

title: Plunkr Template Not Loading
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:

Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?

It runs

#### What is the current behavior?

It doesn't run. Throws 404s. 

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

Simply open the plnkr template below and hit *run*. 


Providing a Plunker (or similar) is the *best* way to get the team to see your issue.
Plunker template: https://goo.gl/DlHd6U


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?

Makes it easier to create new plnks when submitting issues.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Osx
Chrome

#### Is there anything else we should know?

title: Does paginator support i18n?
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:

feature request

#### What is the expected behavior?

The paginator display `Items per page`, it's English.

#### What is the current behavior?

Can I set this text with other languages?

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?

i18n

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

`"@angular/core": "^4.3.3",`
`"@angular/material": "^2.0.0-beta.8",`

title: chore: add md-table to universal app
body: * Adds the md-table component to the universal app. This means that it will be verified by the prerender task on the CI.

title: fix: remove ripples in high contrast mode
body: In high contrast mode the ripples are opaque, which causes them to obstruct the content. These changes hide ripple for high contrast users since it's primarily decorative.

title: fix(paginator): underlying select vertical alignment
body:
Fixes the paginator's `md-select` not being align correctly.

Fixes #6338.

title: perf(observe-content): run outside Angular zone
body:
* Runs the underlying `MutationObserver` outside the Angular zone.
* Runs the debounce timeout outside the Angular zone.

via https://github.com/angular/flex-layout/pull/370.

title: demo(icon): Add an accessibility demo page for icon
demo(progress-spinner): Add progress spinner accessibility demo page
fix(theming): Light green 700 contrast should be white
body:
According to [Material Design Guidelines](https://material.io/guidelines/style/color.html#color-color-palette) Light Green 700 contrast color
should be white.

title: Md-datepicker touchUi is always treated as if touchUi is set to true
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
when touchUi="true" the md-datepicker will be opened in touchscreen mode, but when touchUi="false", md-datepicker will be opened as a popup under the input

#### What is the current behavior?
even when touchUi="false" md-datepicker opens in touchscreen mode

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

Providing a Plunker (or similar) is the *best* way to get the team to see your issue.
Plunker template: http://plnkr.co/edit/XcGBezjJ27qYTRdvQt0v?p=preview (I changed an existing plunker with md-datepicker I found and added the touchUi="false".)


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
I want to be able use a boolean 'showInTouchMode' like this: [touchUi]="showInTouchMode".

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
I use in my package.json among others:
        "@angular/common": "4.3.1",
        "@angular/cdk": "2.0.0-beta.8",
        "@angular/material": "2.0.0-beta.8",
        "typescript": "2.4.1"

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Not about this point, but I would really appreciate more examples in the documentation at material.angular.io. How exactly should I customize md-datepicker with the parse and display formats? And How exactly should I localize labels and messages? For example, how should a 'MY_DATE_FORMATS' file look?

title: Md-data-table select row
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Feature request, proposal

#### What is the expected behavior?
There should be a data-table with a checkbox on one side, whitch allows the user to select a row an work with the data in it.

#### What is the current behavior?
There is no such table. 

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
This could be a usefull feature for many applications

title: Expose mdRipple instance in MdButton components
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
feature request: Developers should have a way to programmatically trigger md-button ripples.

#### What is the current behavior?
To the best of my knowledge, Angular doesn't provide any way to access directive instances on on descendants of components declared in a template. The closest I can get to accessing the ripple is by getting a reference to the `MdButton` instance.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
I'm making a carousel-type component that allows using the keyboard arrow keys to navigate. As a nice touch of visual feedback, I'd like to trigger a ripple on the buttons on keydown. 

Here I've monkeypatched `MdButton` to demonstrate what I want:
https://embed.plnkr.co/rpfqsqCblKF3odzD8DVx/

It's also useful if I want to implement a basic version of the feature discovery pattern:
https://material.io/guidelines/growth-communications/feature-discovery.html

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Latest

#### Is there anything else we should know?
It might be useful to expose this on other components that implement ripples. It should be as simple as adding a `ViewChild` and documenting its existence as a component property.

title: Paginator "Items per page" select out of alignment
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
The md-select used to select number of items per page is unaligned with the text

#### What is the current behavior?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5668416/29051768-e542f2b4-7b99-11e7-8789-4fd083b11d8f.png)
Should be aligned

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Create a simple md-paginator.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
angular/material@master

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Introduced by #6228, specifically this line: https://github.com/angular/material2/pull/6228/files#diff-a75bbde914dfea515b1f0c67ebcb8089R79

title: build: fix screenshot tool deployment
body: * Currently the screenshot tool application is not built in the deploy script. This causes Firebase to throw an error because the target directory does not exist.

title: feat(overlay): support setting multiple panel classes
body:
Allows for more than one class to be added via the `panelClass` option.

Fixes #6318.

title: [autocomplete] indent with custom input
chore(): add sort module to universal app
body:
* Adds the `MdSortModule` to the universal app. This means that it will be part of the prerender check on the CI.

**Note**: It makes sense to check the `mdSort` module because it includes components and directives that may cause problems in the server platform.

title: feat(datepicker): close calendar after choose the same date again
md-sidenav on a component janks scrolling
body:
Hey guys,
- I don't know if this is a bug but I'm seeing lots of janky scrolling on mobile devices when I try to use a sidenav on a single component. Anyone noticed this?

Global application markup:

```
<!-- Main application -->
<md-sidenav-container>
   <md-sidenav #sidenav mode="over">
   Global menu
   </md-sidenav>

<router-outlet></router-outlet>
</md-sidenav-container>
```

This works great - pretty standard. The router-outlet is where I put all the content. But then on on of my routes I want to have another sidenav on the other side, and here it goes bad..

/mycomponent.html
```

<md-sidenav-container>

    <md-sidenav #clubfilter mode="over" opened="false" align="end">
        In-componet sidenav
   </md-sidenav>

     This is the main content of the component.

</md-sidenav-container>
```


The content in mycomponent is a long scrollable list. If I setup the sidenav it works - but scrolling becomes almost impossible on mobile devices - but it's still ok on desktop.

Any advice?

Thanks a bunch

title: Support dense layout for inputs
body: Feature request to support dense layout for inputs according to Material specification: https://material.io/guidelines/components/text-fields.html#text-fields-text-field-boxes

title: Support multiple classes in MdDialog's panelClass
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Feature request

#### What is the expected behavior?
I want MdDialogConfig to have option for panelClass to be an array of classes, like
`panelClass: ['custom-container', 'widget-container']`

#### What is the current behavior?
Currently there could be only one panelClass per dialog

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
I want to add various classes depending on environment, but i have no such option  and i have to include all possible combinations into separate classes

title: ci: shorter wait timeout for saucelabs and browserstack
body:
Changes the wait timeout for Saucelabs and Browserstack from 2 minutes to 1 minute. 

This is now possible because if the timeout fails, we still re-try to create a connection a second time.

title: MdCheckbox + ServerModule - Cannot read property 'trim' of undefined
feat(datepicker): export unexported components for potential extension
body: Although the team has export those files, but users can't redeclare them in another NgModule for angular constraints. It's impossible for someone to extend the functionality or create a custom date(time)picker view without this patch.
